title: DNC increases polling and donation criteria for December Democratic debate
text:
USA TODAY

WASHINGTON – The Democratic National Committee announced Friday new, more difficult criteria to qualify for the sixth primary debate in December — a move that will likely continue to chisel away at the number of presidential hopefuls on stage.

To qualify for the December debate, which is the last of the year, candidates must receive 4% or more support in at least four polls, which include national polls or polls in the early voting states of Iowa, New Hampshire, South Carolina or Nevada.

Candidates could also meet the polling criteria by hitting 6% support in two single-state polls in Iowa, New Hampshire, South Carolina or Nevada.

The new polling criteria is up slightly from the November debate qualifications, where candidates need at least 3% in four approved national or early state polls, or at least 5% in two early state polls.

More:Rep. Tulsi Gabbard to not seek another term in Congress, will continue running for president

In addition, candidates need to get at least 200,000 unique donors, with a minimum of 800 unique donors per state in at least 20 U.S. states, U.S. territories, or the District of Columbia.

The DNC also listed 16 pollsters it will accept. The polls must also be released between Oct. 16 to Dec. 12 at 11:59 p.m.

Vice President Joe Biden, Sen. Elizabeth Warren and Sen. Bernie Sanders are the only candidates that have qualified for the December debate thus far, according to Politico.

An interactive guide:Who is running for president in 2020?

In addition, the DNC announced the location and who will host the sixth debate.

The debate will be held on Dec. 19 at the UCLA Luskin School of Public Affairs and will be co-hosted by PBS Newshour and POLITICO. It will air live on PBS and across PBS NewsHour digital platforms, as well as on Politico’s digital and social platforms. Moderators for the debate will be announced at a later date.
description: The new criteria will likely agan narrow the number of candidates on the December debate stage. Thus far, only three have hit the qualifying marks.
